author: Joe Rodgers (joseph.rodgers@peformgroup.com)
title: Steelers make Antonio Brown highest-paid WR in NFL, reports say
text:
February 27, 2017 5:47pm   5:42pm EST American Football, News, English, Antonio Brown, NFL, Pittsburgh Steelers The Steelers rewarded their standout wide receiver with a new contract that will make him the highest-paid receiver in the NFL. Antonio Brown (Getty Images) 
Updated at 5:47 p.m. ET 
Updated at 5:47 p.m. ET 
Antonio Brown has ranked either first or second in the NFL in receptions over the last four years, and the Steelers rewarded their standout wide receiver Monday with a new contract that sets him to be a Steeler for life. 
The new five-year contract will reportedly make Brown the NFL's highest-paid receiver. Antonio Brown deal: 4-year extension worth $68 million - 17M per year over 4 years, and $18.5M over 3 years. Tied to Steelers through 2021. — Adam Schefter (@AdamSchefter) February 27, 2017 
"AB is a big contributor to our success, has been for several years now, and I think he’s capable of continuing to be that kind of player," Steelers president Art Rooney II said. "I think he’s someone who wants to be a great player and works hard to be that. Hopefully, he’ll continue to evolve as a player and as a person." 
Going on 29, Brown was set to make $4.71 million in the final year of a six-year restructured contract, but now he'll easily make more than salary leaders A.J. Green, Julio Jones and Dez Bryant. — Antonio Brown (@AntonioBrown) February 27, 2017 Read This
